comments.commentBody:
Chris Christie, the worst of the worst.
Terrified kindergarteners on their first days of school.
Worried parents.
Slowed down ambulances, medical emergencies.
Just so CC could become President.
Then CC endorses Trump, probably to get his campaign loans paid off.
And Trump hires Stepien.
The good thing is that eventually Chris Christie ends up a big fat loser.
The people of the good state he governs hate him.
Will the same happen to Trump, a bigger crook on a bigger scale?
One can hope.
Then you need to actively search out the bad guys and report them if your community wants to do good for the world.

Correct. There is absolutely no justification for any of these acts in Islamic law. What we are seeing is frustrated demented individuals who grow beards and then pretend like they are doing something to help their religion, but as as the Prophet Muhammad said 'their faith does not even go beyond their throats'. These are individuals who have the outward appearance of Muslims but are in reality clearly in violation of just about every classical understanding of relations with those around you and the Islamic focus on good behavior as a means to earn salvation.

@Hamza:

Yes.

But the Qur'an is different things to different people, depending.

Years ago a Egyptian grad student at U. Chicago advised me never to travel from Cairo south to Minya because local men who knew little about the world except what their imams preached about it might attack me -- on the street, in broad daylight -- merely because I "looked American".

He was quite emphatic about it.

Much of Egypt wasn't safe for westerners to travel even in groups, forget alone (my penchant). And this was long before "Pharaoh" Mubarak's overthrow.

Now, of course, it's infinitely more dangerous.

The Holy Qur'an might be a great book -- but it is only a book; its verses interpreted and reinterpreted by Islamic scholars. Some are learned, enlightened and insightful. Others are ignorant, narrow-minded and hateful; as suits their purposes.

Mr. Rahami fell under the spell of the latter type, evidently.

Classic. A one man army of darkness, and a coward.

No brave Islamic Warrior here.

No support network that I can see, either. I find that missing element almost inexplicable.

No prepared switchbacks or fallback positions. No plan, evidently, beyond randomly dropping booby traps and running.

No secret bastion stocked with food, creature comforts and supplies; why he collapsed from sheer exhaustion on a city street. That part reminds me of John Allen Muhammad and Lee Boyd Malvo, the "Washington Beltway Snipers" who were captured while asleep inside their battered old Chevrolet Caprice at a Maryland rest stop.

Just another sad, demented little guy who drank al-Qaeda's purple Cool Aid and destroyed his life pointlessly trying to kill others the Qur'an condemns as Infidels.
Amen.
Maybe, but they aren't calling it "radical Islamic terror" so it's hard to give law enforcement a passing grade here.
Very proud of law enforcement in this attack.  A swift response is a strong deterrent.

Dear Mr. R.: I enjoy sarcasm, but don't you think that your sarcastic words will be "cut and pasted" into conspiracy minded Trumpians and re-broadcast and re-tweeted as if you weren't being sarcastic.
What does "e pluribus unum" mean? "Out of many, one" or "One out of many"?
Every word counts, and each counts in a certain order and context!

I was agreeing right up to the end when you said that the myth pushers truly believe their lies. I doubt that's true and it's certainly not necessary for the lies to work.
Do you really think Donald Trump believes the things he says, over and over, louder and louder?

Never, ever underestimate the power of propaganda. Never, ever underestimate the ease that people can be persuaded. Never, ever underestimate the desperation that people have for authority figures to tell them what they want to hear.

Such is the success of voter fraud. Here is how it works.

Everyone I know voted for my guy. My guy didn't win. How could that happen? The election must be rigged. All these high ranking officials in government tell me that the election was rigged by voter fraud. My trusted sources of news tell me, and almost daily, that voter fraud is rampant. They even have all these studies to prove it. But the left wing media led by the New York Times and that socialist PBS say the studies are false. They are the real liars. Besides there are 11 million illegals here and all they have to do is walk in and vote. Millions of votes against my guy.

See how easy it is. All of the motivation and stimulus is there to cause people to swallow the entire voter fraud lie. The true fraud is perpetuating that voter fraud exists. But that is easy to get away with. Example: We all know that Obama really was born in Kenya. Trump just said he was born here to make the establishment Republicans happy. But we know the real truth. He's a Kenyan Muslim. The real lie is that he isn't.

That's how the voter fraud myth works. What's really scary is that the myth pushers are so immersed in the lie, they truly believe it themselves.
Saw the video on television and just could not believe my eyes.  I am sick and nauseated and fearful for our black citizens.

A lone unarmed black pastor who's vehicle had broken down on the road was shot dead a few days ago in Tulsa by one of several police called to breakdown, one in a helicopter said the Christian pastor looked like a "bad dude" before he was shot.

http://www.nytimes.com/2016/09/20/us/video-released-in-terence-crutchers...

Authority-sanctioned human and civil rights violations like this (the unarmed pastor shooting) happen on a weekly basis in our country, with hundreds of innocent Americans shot and killed annually. Where's the outrage about these innocent Americans being shot? Was the pastor guilty of reaching for his driver's license or keys? A white pastor was recently shot in OK too during a flood rescue, time to ratchet down the looney violence people, the fear and loathing across the board starting from the top down? Time to set a healthy non-violent example to the larger world and for ourselves? What kind of a society do we live in in 2016 when armed authorities are to be feared as much as terrorists? The American people are being assaulted from both sides.

Open 24 hours?

Sounds a little strange for that area - are they sure the restaurant was only selling chicken?

The same exact people ?

That's quite a story there ...

President Obama and Secretary Clinton can give more lectures about Gun Control and Islamophobia.

Maybe Islamic terrorism is not an issue with Muslim refugees.

After all, Ahmad Raham, restaurateur and Tashfeen Malik, the wife and partner of the San Bernadino mass killer were both vetted by the same people screening Syrian refugees.
Well put in every word - and my thoughts exactly!

A recent survey showed that 70 percent of American disagree with the actions of Kaepernick, Rapinoe and others.

The booing when Rapinoe entered the game in Atlanta, as well as every time she touched the ball, was representative as well - and that was people who had paid good money for tickets to the game.

The only thing he's good for is a prosecutor.
Loved it when he ripped apart Rubio during the so called Republican debates.
Sorry, rella, but Carli Lloyd stated in an interview yesterday that Rapinoe's demonstrations have indeed been a distraction to the team.

I would disagree. My problem with these part-time activists is that their miscellaneous acts (they don't even do the same thing) are creating more controversy. None of this is drawing interest to the REAL issues in this country, and none of this is initiating discussions or other efforts to resolve those issues.

This isn't calling attention to any actual issues, and it certainly isn't making any progress to discuss police brutality or inequalities. These folks would be MUCH better served to TALK about these issues rather than creating more controversy.

I'd have more respect if she took the time, away from competition, to LEAD discussions and efforts to resolve the REAL issues in this country. Instead, she, Colin Kaepernick and others have simply created more controversy.

You mean to say, "My way or the highway"? Sounds like the AT atop Mount Katahdin has become a highway. If it were ONLY the record-setting experience — fine, PERHAPS. But the accompanying brouhaha is too bleedin' much.
He did it his way and set the record. Period.
And let's not demean Hot Dog eating contests, either.
That is my experience with meditation too; doing it about 5 years now.

There is clearly a ground for corporate interest here. Employees who meditate will be healthier and therefore cheaper and more reliable. They will also be more emotionally stable. They might well be more compliant, too. Wise employers should make meditation training mandatory. It looks as if it produces everything an employer could want. And everything an employee could want. Productive employees make more money, and more money means satisfying more desires. This is a win all the way around..
Too bad you don't take insurance.

I can attest to the fact that meditation is effective for ADHD. I was on Concerta for ADHD but did not like the fact that it is basically speed -- especially the risks of that as I get older. I found that a daily dose of 20 minutes of meditation accomplishes the same as a daily dose of Concerta. And it had many other benefits, as well.

I found that meditation has made me more compassionate because I feel more compassionate to myself after 20 minutes of mindfulness practice.  I still have problems sleeping but I don't kill anyone if I wake up with only 4 hours of sleep under my belt.  :D

I find it strange that anyone would rely on a scientific study regarding the practice of meditation. I've been meditating regularly for some 40 years. I have found it profoundly useful. Try it and judge for yourself.
Every time I think about meditation, the word "phrenology" pops into my head. Can't help it.
